column5: Just wondering if the ice is on its way out on Nippising yet.My buddy bought a new Alumicraft up there and has to wait till they can test his boat before he can pick it up.He don't say much but I'm sure he is going bonkers waiting for that magical day when he can go get his new boat.We have been fishing open water down here for 2 weeks now and I'm sure thats not helping much.  Thanks
Here's a sattelite image shot yesterday at 5pm...  http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/modis/mod...on.143.250m.jpg  River looks ok, lake looks pretty frozen still.

Nipissing still for the most part is ice covered. Fish Bay is about half open but that happened a couple weeks ago. Some has since refrozen Be at least two weeks yet, more cold weather next week. yuuuk!
If he bought the boat at ASM in Sturgeon Falls   he can test the boat today... the river is thawed.   RFS

Thanks guys.He got the call to pick it up in 2 weeks.They say the river is open put alot of crap floating in the water right now.Can't wait to see it.She looks like a beauty in the pictures.I think Alumacrafts are a top of the line boat.
Still ice on today..  just drove by!!

Will be a while yet. Anything with current opened up quick. Everything else is gonna be a couple weeks.  I took a drive north on the weekend looking for ice-out brookie/splake prospects and they are still ICE FISHING!!!  This is only an hour north of Suds.
Can still drive on Temagami in the mornings...
Fish Bay is open. There was just a little ice out from the dock.

Try this webcam view...looking west from downtown North Bay...  http://www.city.north-bay.on.ca/living/bay...on.asp?camera=2   Here's another just north of Callendar...sometimes it is up...sometimes not...  http://torbay.net/torbay1/dockcam.html
I live right on the lake in Sturgeon and there's still plenty left on the lake, here's hoping this warm weather will open things up.
